text:
irth companion matters with women during antenatal care.
• A birth companion can be a partner, a trusted relative, friend or a trained doula.
• Counsel birth companions on providing emotional, and practical support, without interfering with the work of
the health provider.
• A birth companion can assist women in addressing situations when they are not being treated respectfully.
Ideally women should select their birth companion (and a back-up companion) before delivery.
